main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by three military officers in Hillcrest Heights, Maryland on June 27, 1955.
interesting points: The object was observed from approximately 8:00 p.m. to 9:10 p.m. and was described as a yellowish, very brilliant object with a trail 4 to 5 times the length of the object.
The object exhibited erratic motion, stopping, oscillating, and then moving off at high speed.
The object did not make any sound.
Searchlights trained on the area went out when the object approached, and the ceiling lights at Washington National Airport also went out when the object passed over.
The investigation concluded that the sighting was likely of a weather balloon being carried by prevailing winds, despite the object's unusual behavior.
sighted object: yellowish, very brilliant object with a trail
